DOC.brief_summary: To determine patient satisfaction preference Total Knee Arthroplasty ( TKA ) vs Unicompartmental Knee Arthroplasty ( UKA ) patient bilateral knee osteoarthritis underwent primary TKA one side primary UKA opposite side minimum two year post-surgery . Patient report outcome data analyze along retrospective chart data .
DOC.brief_title: Bilateral Total Knee Arthroplasty v Unicompartment Arthroplasty Retrospective Clinical Outcome Study
DOC.criteria: 1 . Must able read , understand provide write informed consent Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approve Informed Consent Form ( ICF ) 2 . Ability understand provide write authorization use disclosure personal health information 3 . Subject able willing comply study protocol followup visit 4 . Must 18 year old participate 5 . Subjects must clinically document osteoarthritis knee , single multiple compartment 6 . Subjects must undergo primary TKA primary UKA contralateral knee 7 . Must minimum 2 year ( 24 month ) postsurgery knee 8 . One TKA/UKA surgery must perform Principal Investigator . 9 . Subjects must able return followup appointment , mental capacity cooperate PRO 's , questionnaire , physical exam radiograph 1 . Subjects underwent UKA Patella Femoral Joint ( PFJ ) replacement side . 2 . Women pregnant
